diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Congenital Secondary Hypothyroidism due to Exon Skipping in the TSH/H9252-subunit gene
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The final diagnosis was made based on the identification of a homozygous mutation in the donor splice site of the TSH/H9252 gene, which was confirmed through sequencing. The mutation led to exon skipping, producing a severely truncated TSH molecule with no biological activity, corroborated by the patient's clinical presentation of typical symptoms of hypothyroidism and laboratory findings indicating low TSH and thyroid hormone levels.
